Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, possibly a column-krater; interior glazed streaky black; exterior, above: black-figure decoration consisting of gymnasium scene (from left, part of leg of one athlete, to left; at centre, wrestler with only shoulders and head of wrestler missing to right, being grasped by the forearms by another, whose foot and leg are partly preserved); three rosettes with central dot as filling ornament; below, narrow brown band; below, part of a feline tail, to right among rosettes as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1888,0601.571.a, 1888,0601.571.b and 1888,0601.571.c. The sherd joins British Museum 1965,0930.803, which shows that the left figure is most likely a boxer
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0131) (Phase 1)
